title: Safe House
description: A cleanup crew attempts to erase evidence, but the safe house contains hidden exit protocols.

scenes.narrative: The cleanup crew has moved to a designated safe house to destroy evidence. They're working methodically through the files.

choices.label: Attempt to negotiate with the crew for information.
choices.consequence: Some crew members provide details about the evidence destruction process.

choices.label: Prioritize evidence preservation over crew apprehension.
choices.consequence: You secure critical evidence before it can be destroyed.

choices.label: Use remote access tools to lock down the safe house systems.
choices.consequence: System lockdown prevents evidence destruction and traps the crew.

choices.label: The safe house has hidden exits - they're planning to escape.
choices.consequence: You discover concealed exit protocols that the crew was preparing to use.

scenes.narrative: The crew has been contained, but they're demanding legal representation. Evidence recovery is critical.

choices.label: Handle the crew's demands professionally to maintain cooperation.
choices.consequence: Professional handling leads to additional intelligence from the crew.

choices.label: Document all evidence with forensic precision.
Extract digital evidence from crew devices.
choices.consequence: Device extraction reveals communication logs and planning details.

choices.label: The cleanup was too thorough - they were hiding something bigger.
choices.consequence: You find evidence of a larger operation that the cleanup was meant to conceal.
